description: If the final two digits of n written in base 3 are the same then this digit, otherwise mod 3-sum of these two digits.
links: Index entries for sequences related to final digits of numbers
example: a(22)=1 since 22 is written in base 3 as 211 and the final two digits are 1; a(23)=0 since 23 is written in base 3 as 212 and the final two digits are 1 and 2 and 3-(1+2)=0.
mathematica: b3d[n_]:=Module[{d3=Take[IntegerDigits[n,3],-2]},If[MatchQ[d3,{x_, x_}], d3[[1]],3-Total[d3]]]; Join[{0,2,1},Array[b3d,110,3]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 29 2016 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 04 2001
